item.title: Matt Hancock: Calls for health secretary to quit after kissing colleague
item.description: Fellow Tory MPs say he should go after being pictured in a clinch with Gina Coladangelo.

item.title: Florida building collapse: Report from 2018 warned of 'major damage'
item.description: A survey flagged "major structural damage" at the complex which collapsed on Thursday near Miami.

item.title: Covid: Sydney lockdown extended as Delta outbreak grows
item.description: Australia's biggest city and surrounding areas enter a two-week lockdown following a jump in cases.

item.title: Hairdressers fear staff crisis after apprentice shortage
item.description: The pandemic caused the already decreasing number of apprentices to fall further, hairdressers say.

item.title: London protests: Thousands march through capital in day of protest
item.description: Protests take place across London, including anti-lockdown and climate change demonstrations.

item.title: LAX: Man jumps from plane after trying to access cockpit
item.description: The man, who fled via the emergency slide, was detained on the taxiway at Los Angeles Airport.

item.title: Covid quarantine hotels: Women say they were sexually harassed by guards
item.description: One woman tells the BBC a security guard employed by G4S mimed sex while they were alone in a lift.

item.title: Glasgow MP moved to safe house after death threat
item.description: Carol Monaghan wants better protection for public figures after online abuse became a real threat.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Grab a jab' for all over-18s opens in England
item.description: Any adult will be able to get a vaccine without an appointment this weekend at hundreds of walk-in sites.

item.title: Sydenham stabbing: Murder probe into 19-year-old's death
item.description: The victim's mother has visited the scene in south-east London where her son was killed, police say.

item.title: 'We got justice, but not enough justice'
item.description: People in Minneapolis reacted to the sentencing of Derek Chauvin on Friday.

item.title: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson endorsed as DUP leader
item.description: Sir Jeffrey Donaldson is the only candidate to put his name forward for the party leadership.

item.title: How a patient treated 280 miles from home died on the M11 hard shoulder
item.description: Peggy Copeman, 81, was neglected by a private ambulance service, a coroner concludes.

item.title: ICYMI: Spider-Man meets the Pope
item.description: A nuisance bear, overheated otters and a special guest for the Pope, some of the stories you may have missed this week.

item.title: Russia's Euro 2020 Covid dilemma
item.description: Russia is hosting Euro 2020 matches but the alarm is being sounded about a new wave of coronavirus.

item.title: Bioluminescence: Photographer's five-year wait to capture blue sea glow
item.description: Gareth Mon Jones says he went to the beach 15 nights in a row to find a bioluminescence display.

item.title: Ely pub's 'quirky' tankard investigated by council
item.description: The giant drinking vessel on the side of a pub is described as "a monstrosity" on social media.

item.title: Ros Atkins Onâ€¦Why the Olympics is going ahead
item.description: Ros Atkins examines the decision to hold the Tokyo Olympics during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: UFO Pentagon report: Do Americans believe something's out there?
item.description: A highly anticipated US government report on UFOs has been released. Is the truth out there?

item.title: Week in pictures: 19 - 25 June 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Miami building collapse: What happened, and how quickly?
item.description: Maps, images and graphics of what we know about a 12-storey residential building's collapse north of Miami.

item.title: Sea shanty singer's rise from postie to popstar 'kind of thing you dream of'
item.description: Nathan Evans talks to BBC Scotland's The Edit about playing the Brits and being on the bill at TRNSMT.

item.title: Infected blood: Parents and pupils reveal they were kept in dark at stricken school
item.description: In a week of harrowing testimony, ex-pupils described how 72 friends died of Aids and hepatitis.

item.title: E10 petrol: What is it and can my car run it?
item.description: A more eco-friendly petrol is coming to filling stations in the UK - but it's not suitable for all cars.

item.title: 'Working from home has helped me keep a full-time job'
item.description: People reveal how technology has helped or hindered them during the pandemic, using #MyAccessiblePandemic.

item.title: Matt Hancock: How did health secretary break Covid restrictions?
item.description: Matt Hancock admits breaching social distancing guidelines after newspaper prints photos of him and an aide embracing.

item.title: William Blake: Biography offers glimpse into artist and poet's visionary mind
item.description: A new book, and fresh medical studies, seem to re-frame the artist and poet's famous visions.

item.title: The students calling out China on Australia's campuses
item.description: Students in Australia speaking out against the Chinese state are facing threats and intimidation.

item.title: The builders with the secret to work-life balance
item.description: A forklift driver can't work from home, but there are other ways the industry can offer more flexibility.

item.title: Female genital mutilation (FGM): 'I had it, but my daughters won't'
item.description: Two mothers subjected to FGM tell how they will not let their daughters suffer the same.

item.title: Why a Kenyan road sign has become a burning issue
item.description: How Kenya's union leader Francis Atwoli is dividing opinion after a street was named after him.

item.title: British & Irish Lions 28-10 Japan: Alun Wyn Jones injury mars routine warm-up win
item.description: The British & Irish Lions warm up for their South African tour with a four-try win over Japan marred by an injury to captain Alun Wyn Jones.

item.title: Alaphilippe wins crash-affected stage one of Tour de France
item.description: Julian Alaphilippe springs a superb late attack to win stage one of the Tour de France after two huge crashes in the closing stages.

item.title: Verstappen on Styrian GP pole ahead of Hamilton
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen beats the Mercedes of Valtteri Bottas and Lewis Hamilton to take pole position at the Styrian Grand Prix.

item.title: Euro 2020: A team reborn, Roberto Mancini's transformed Italy 'dream big'
item.description: Reborn under manager Roberto Mancini, Italy are dreaming of winning Euro 2020 with their thrilling new playing style.

item.title: Euro 2020: Wales to be ruthless against neutrals' favourites Denmark
item.description: Wales were loved at Euro 2016 but on Saturday they will be ruthless against Denmark, the neutrals' heroes of Euro 2020.

item.title: Euro 2020: Lawro takes on BBC Radio 5 Live pundits, presenters and commentators to predict the last-16 matches
item.description: BBC Sport's football expert Mark Lawrenson takes on BBC Radio 5 Live pundits, presenters and commentators to make his predictions for the last-16 ties at Euro 2020.

item.title: Euro 2020: Reviewing the boots worn by Griezmann, Sterling, Pogba & Ronaldo
item.description: Football boots expert JayMike dials in from Denmark to talk BBC Sport's Liam Loftus through the football boots making their mark at Euro 2020.

item.title: Euro 2020: Phil Foden explains England's preparations for penalties
item.description: England's Phil Foden explains how the players are preparing for the possibility of a penalty shootout with Germany in the last 16 of Euro 2020.

item.title: Euro 2020: England v Germany - pick your Three Lions starting XI
item.description: England topped their group at Euro 2020 with two wins and a draw - now who would you pick for their last-16 game against Germany?

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Covid rules are making things a bit different for Euro 2020 spectators.

item.title: Travel guide to Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as almost 44 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Vaccine passports: How can I prove I've had both my Covid jabs?
item.description: People who've had both Covid jabs may soon be able to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: The government is considering allowing double vaccinated adults to avoid quarantine after travel.

item.title: Coronavirus: When can we stop wearing face masks or coverings?
item.description: Wearing a face covering is currently a legal requirement in many places, but could the rules change as lockdown eases further?

item.title: Covid: How is furlough changing and when will it end?
item.description: Furlough has been extended until the end of September

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Over-18s can get a first jab in England, Wales and Northern Ireland, and second jabs are being brought forward.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Can we stop worrying about high case numbers?
item.description: As vaccination reduces serious illness from Covid-19, the Scottish government is changing its strategy.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: Covid: How is Europe lifting lockdown restrictions?
item.description: Europe is gradually easing lockdown measures ahead of the tourist season.

item.title: Euro 2020: Why are England players self-isolating?
item.description: Two England players are self-isolating after a Scotland player tested positive for Covid.

item.title: Covid: Ivermectin to be studied as possible treatment in UK
item.description: Scientists begin to give the drug to people at home with symptoms to see if it can keep them out of hospital.

item.title: A fake wedding, and a $250,000 scam
item.description: How a British man's dreams of a future with his Ukrainian fiancee ended in financial disaster.

item.title: Gary Allen: The killer who nearly got away with murder
item.description: Gary Allen's conviction for the murders of two women brings a 20-year quest for justice to an end.

item.title: Wimbledon: Roger Federer's epic victory over Pete Sampras, 20 years on
item.description: At Wimbledon in 2001, a teenage hopeful took on the serial champion. It was a match for the ages - the only time two greats met.

item.title: The Lazarus heist: How North Korea almost pulled off a billion-dollar hack
item.description: In 2016 North Korean hackers planned a $1bn raid on Bangladesh's national bank and came within an inch of success. But how did they do it?

item.title: Daniel Morgan: Last chance for family in Britain's most-investigated, unsolved murder
item.description: The death of Daniel Morgan is Britain's most investigated unsolved murder. His family believe police corruption, and reluctance to confront it, could explain the murder and the failed investigations
